content:
Q: If I am not at fault for the accident but make an own damage claim, will my NCD be affected?
A: Your NCD will not be affected if we can recover the claim amount from the other party. However, if the claim recovery is not successful, your NCD will be affected. Alternatively, if you have been successful in your counter claim for excess and loss of use (at least 80% success rate), we can look into your request to reinstate NCD, subject to supporting documents.
questions: What happens to my NCD if I make an own damage claim but am not at fault?
Will my NCD be affected if the insurance company cannot recover the claim from the other party?
Can my NCD be reinstated if I successfully counter claim for excess and loss of use?
What is the required success rate for a counter claim to consider NCD reinstatement?
What documents are needed to support a request for NCD reinstatement after a counter claim?
Is there a scenario where making an own damage claim does not affect my NCD?
What does it mean to recover the claim amount from the other party in terms of NCD impact?
How does the success of a claim recovery affect my NCD status?
Under what conditions will my NCD remain unaffected if I am not at fault in an accident?
What percentage of success in a counter claim is considered for NCD reinstatement?
